name: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA
mission: CAIR works to protect and defend the constitutional rights of American Muslims, thereby supporting the rights of all Americans.
theoryOfChange: By combining legal action, policy advocacy, and community empowerment, CAIR-CA seeks to dismantle systemic Islamophobia and protect the constitutional rights of Muslims.

score_details.score_summary: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA earns 54/100 due to good alignment and moderate impact.

all_citations.claim: The organization focuses on civil rights advocacy and maintains specific financial health metrics including working capital.
The charity reported total revenue of $17,442,755 and a program expense ratio of 83.7%.
The organization provides various donation options for supporters to contribute via sadaqah.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains strong financial health and efficient operations, though its overall score is moderated by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external evidence of long-term longitudinal impact on beneficiary outcomes.
Moderate alignment with specific global educational urgency metrics.

dimension_explanations.alignment: CAIR-CA offers a medium fit for donors, focusing on domestic civil rights and global education advocacy [1]. Donors can contribute through various sadaqah-eligible giving methods to support these legal and policy-driven efforts [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a commitment to operational efficiency, allocating 83.7% of its $17,442,755 revenue toward its programs [2]. While it maintains a high data confidence level and strong working capital of 14.5 months, its impact score reflects a focus on capacity building and systemic advocacy rather than direct, high-volume beneficiary metrics [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California defends the constitutional rights of American Muslims through robust civil rights advocacy and legal services.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 83.7% ensures the majority of funds directly support civil rights and advocacy initiatives.
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.07 per $1 raised.
Strong liquidity position with 14.5 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) operates as a leading grassroots civil rights and advocacy organization dedicated to protecting the liberties of the Muslim community [1]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a total revenue of $17,442,755 to support its core programs in policy, media relations, and legal defense [2].

all_citations.quote: Your donation helps us protect civil rights

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains strong financial health and efficient operations, though its overall score is moderated by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.

areas_for_improvement.context: While the organization tracks <cite id="1">5 distinct outcome metrics</cite>, it currently lacks <cite id="5">long-term longitudinal evidence</cite> of beneficiary outcomes.
To improve its impact score, the charity should <cite id="5">track and report specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable a more accurate cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization is an Accredited Charity meeting all standards for accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively tracking 5 outcome metrics through Candid to improve its evidence base.
risk_factors: <cite id="5">No specific beneficiary counts reported</cite> for cost-analysis
<cite id="5">Developing theory of change</cite> rather than a fully documented causal model
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="5">lack of rigorous, third-party impact evaluations</cite> common in larger international NGOs.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data and transparency signals.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for donors focused on <cite id="1">domestic civil rights</cite> and supporting the <cite id="5">ibn sabil (wayfarer)</cite> category through legal aid.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this organization due to its <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and a <cite id="1">93% independent board of directors</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, the organization could <cite id="5">document a clear theory of change with a causal pathway</cite> for its advocacy work.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="1">83.7% program ratio</cite>, though impact is currently <cite id="5">measured through capacity building</cite> rather than external evaluations.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="5">seeking external evaluation</cite> or tracking outcomes consistently for over 3 years.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Outcome tracking via Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes funds to local partners for immigration and humanitarian support

rich_narrative.headline: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California defends the constitutional rights of American Muslims through robust civil rights advocacy and legal services.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize domestic civil rights protections and want to fund legal infrastructure that defends the constitutional liberties of American Muslims.
donor_motivations: Want to support legal defense for victims of discrimination
Value high financial efficiency and low overhead costs
Care about the political and social standing of Muslims in the US
Prefer supporting established grassroots organizations with local impact
giving_considerations: Impact is measured through systemic advocacy rather than individual aid metrics
The organization has a high funding gap despite recent revenue growth
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those who require randomized controlled trial (RCT) evidence of impact.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while <cite id="1">5 outcome metrics are tracked</cite>, there is no external longitudinal evaluation of long-term impact.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: CAIR-CA aims to protect civil liberties and promote an accurate image of Muslims through <cite id="1">media partnerships, public official engagement, and legal services</cite>.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that advocacy and legal interventions are effectively reducing discrimination and protecting rights.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite <cite id="4">49.7% revenue growth</cite>, the organization maintains a <cite id="5">3/5 funding gap score</cite>, indicating significant unmet need in civil rights advocacy.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: California (Los Angeles, San Diego, Sacramento, Orange County)

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="1">83.7% program expense ratio</cite>, which significantly exceeds the <cite id="4">peer median of 78.4%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on advocacy and legal services

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="1">83.7% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that nearly all contributions directly fund civil rights and legal services.
With <cite id="1">14.5 months of working capital</cite> in reserve, the charity is well-positioned to withstand economic fluctuations.
CAIR-CA demonstrates lean operations, spending only <cite id="1">$0.07 to raise every $1</cite> in charitable contributions.

strengths_deep_dive: CAIR-CA's operational model is characterized by high transparency and fiscal discipline, evidenced by its <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. The organization's ability to scale is reflected in its <cite id="4">49.7% three-year revenue growth rate</cite>, moving from approximately $7.7 million in 2021 to over <cite id="2">$17.4 million in 2023</cite>. This growth has not compromised efficiency, as the <cite id="1">93% independent board</cite> oversees a structure where <cite id="2">83.7% of total expenses</cite> are dedicated to its core mission of civil rights protection and legal advocacy.
rich_narrative.summary: The Council on American-Islamic Relations California (CAIR-CA) serves as a critical legal and advocacy infrastructure for the American Muslim community, focusing on <cite id="1">protecting and defending constitutional rights</cite>. As a grassroots organization, it operates across major California hubs including <cite id="1">Los Angeles, San Diego, and Sacramento</cite> to provide direct legal services and civil rights protection. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization demonstrated significant growth, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $17,442,755</cite>, which represents a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 49.7%</cite>. This financial expansion supports a robust program model where <cite id="1">83.7% of expenses are directed toward program services</cite>, including immigration legal aid and community education. By maintaining <cite id="1">14.5 months of working capital</cite>, the organization ensures long-term stability for its advocacy efforts. CAIR-CA also functions as a significant grantmaker within the California non-profit ecosystem, distributing <cite id="2">$4,148,077 in domestic grants</cite> to partners such as the <cite id="2">International Rescue Committee and Jewish Family Services</cite> to support shared humanitarian and legal goals.
